pages.text: The Neomanila $(l)eXplore/$ Advancements can be accessed via the [$(k:advancements)] key. Use the $(item)Nature's Compass/$ to help you find biomes and earn coins:$(br2)Common biomes: 50 $(item)Bronze coins/$$(br)Uncommon biomes: 1 $(item)Silver coin/$$(br)Rare biomes: 50 $(item)Silver coins/$$(br)Very rare biomes: 1 $(item)Gold coin/$$(br2)A bedroll is also convenient when far from your respawn point.

pages.title: Deep Underground
pages.text: Also called 'The Nether' by the locals, this planet's ancient civilization have left technology that allows instantaneous travel between the surface down to a massive subterranean cave system near its core.$(br2)The $(item)Nether Portal/$ can be constructed by placing $(item)Obsidian/$ blocks in a rectangular shape, with at least 2x3 gap inside. Once the portal's frame is complete, light a fire inside to open it.

pages.title: The Lunar Ring
pages.text: High above this planet's atmosphere, a flat ring and a small moon can be found with just enough air for some creatures to survive. The ancient civilization that left the $(item)Nether Portal/$ also travelled towards the Lunar Ring using a similar technology called the $(item)End Portal/$. The way to create these have been lost but there are still some underground ruins where you can find an active portal.$(br2)The locals tell a tale when the night sky had two large moons instead of the Lunar Ring: Dragonstone and Old Chorus. A cataclysmic event pushed one into the other, shattering Old Chorus and leaving only Dragonstone's core, along with the Lunar Ring that we can see today.
